metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: AngularJS Filters
Filters can be added in AngularJS to format data.
content.html: Filters can be added in AngularJS to format data.

content.text: AngularJS Filters
AngularJS provides filters to transform data:
Adding Filters to Expressions
Filters can be added to expressions by using the pipe character | , followed by a filter.
content.html: Filters can be added to expressions by using the pipe character |, followed by a filter.

content.text: The uppercase filter format strings to upper case:
content.html: The uppercase filter format strings to upper case:

content.code: The name is {{ lastName | uppercase }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

<p>The name is {{ lastName | uppercase }}</p>

</div>

content.text: The lowercase filter format strings to lower case:
content.html: The lowercase filter format strings to lower case:

content.code: The name is {{ lastName | lowercase }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

<p>The name is {{ lastName | lowercase }}</p>

</div>

content.text: Adding Filters to Directives
Filters are added to directives, like ng-repeat , by using the pipe character | , followed by a filter:
content.html: Filters are added to directives, like ng-repeat, by using the pipe character |, followed by a filter:

content.code: • {{ x.name + ', ' + x.country }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in names | orderBy:'country'">
    {{ x.name + ', ' + x.country }}
  </li>
</ul>

</div>

content.text: The currency Filter
The currency filter formats a number as currency:
content.html: The currency filter formats a number as currency:

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="costCtrl">

<h1>Price: {{ price | currency }}</h1>

</div>

content.text: Read more about the currency filter in our AngularJS currency Filter Reference
content.html: Read more about the currency filter in our AngularJS currency Filter Reference

content.text: The filter Filter
The filter filter selects a subset of an array.
content.html: The filter filter selects a subset of an array.

content.text: The filter filter can only be used on arrays, and it returns an array containing only the matching items.
content.html: The filter filter can only be used on arrays, and it returns an array containing only the matching items.

content.code: •     {{ x }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in names | filter : 'i'">
    {{ x }}
  </li>
</ul>

</div>

content.text: Read more about the filter filter in our AngularJS filter Filter Reference
content.html: Read more about the filter filter in our AngularJS filter Filter Reference

content.text: Filter an Array Based on User Input
By setting the ng-model directive on an input field, we can use the value of the input field as an expression in a filter.
content.html: By setting the ng-model directive on an input field, we can use the value of the input field as an expression in a filter.

content.text: Type a letter in the input field, and the list will shrink/grow depending on the match:
content.html: Type a letter in the input field, and the list will shrink/grow depending on the match:

content.code: • {{ x }}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">

<p><input type="text" ng-model="test"></p>

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in names | filter : test">
    {{ x }}
  </li>
</ul>

</div>

content.text: Sort an Array Based on User Input
Click the table headers to change the sort order::
content.html: Click the table headers to change the sort order::

content.text: By adding the ng-click directive on the table headers, we can run a function that changes the sorting order of the array:
content.html: By adding the ng-click directive on the table headers, we can run a function that changes the sorting order of the array:

content.code:
NameCountry
{{x.name}}{{x.country}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">

<table border="1" width="100%">
  <tr>
    <th ng-click="orderByMe('name')">Name</th>
    <th ng-click="orderByMe('country')">Country</th>
  </tr>
  <tr ng-repeat="x in names | orderBy:myOrderBy">
    <td>{{x.name}}</td>
    <td>{{x.country}}</td>
  </tr>
</table>

</div>

<script>
angular.module('myApp', []).controller('namesCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.names = [
    {name:'Jani',country:'Norway'},
    {name:'Carl',country:'Sweden'},
    {name:'Margareth',country:'England'},
    {name:'Hege',country:'Norway'},
    {name:'Joe',country:'Denmark'},
    {name:'Gustav',country:'Sweden'},
    {name:'Birgit',country:'Denmark'},
    {name:'Mary',country:'England'},
    {name:'Kai',country:'Norway'}
  ];
  $scope.orderByMe = function(x) {
    $scope.myOrderBy = x;
  }
});
</script>

content.text: Custom Filters
You can make your own filters by registering a new filter factory function with your module:
content.html: You can make your own filters by registering a new filter factory function with your module:

content.code_html:
<ul ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="namesCtrl">
  <li ng-repeat="x in names">
    {{x | myFormat}}
  </li>
</ul>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.filter('myFormat', function() {
  return function(x) {
    var i, c, txt = "";
    for (i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
      c = x[i];
      if (i % 2 == 0) {
        c = c.toUpperCase();
      }
      txt += c;
    }
    return txt;
  };
});
app.controller('namesCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.names = ['Jani', 'Carl', 'Margareth', 'Hege', 'Joe', 'Gustav', 'Birgit', 'Mary', 'Kai'];
});
</script>

content.text: The myFormat filter will format every other character to uppercase.
content.html: The myFormat filter will format every other character to uppercase.
